Teacher Certification and Licensure: Education offers initial teacher certification programs that meet the standards set by the Maryland State Department of Education (MSDE) and the Council for the Accreditation of Educator Preparation (CAEP). Teacher certification programs are completed in conjunction with undergraduate majors and may require coursework in the major field beyond the major requirements. Teacher candidates at UMBC who complete a certification program and pass the tests and performance assessments outlined by MSDE are recommended to Maryland State Department of Education for licensure by the UMBC Education Department. Completion of Minimum University Require: Minimum 120 credits and minimum GPA of 2.0
Completion of 45 upper-level credits, residence requirement, Writing Intensive requirement, and General Education requirement

Program Requirements: Minimum grade of 'C' in courses applied to the program
Completion of a UMBC major relevant to the content area

EDUC 411 - Teaching Literacy in the Content Areas: Part II (3)
EDUC 412 - Analysis of Teaching and Learning (3)
EDUC 456 - Student Teaching in the Secondary Schools (10)

EDUC 425 - Methods of Teaching English in the Secondary Schools (3)

EDUC 427 - Methods of Teaching Science in the Secondary School (3)
